website_summaries.verdict: Rockin' Green's powder detergent helps save your dirty gym clothes.
pros: This detergent works well in a machine, or in a bathtub soak
The formula can lift years of set-in sweat and stains from physical activity
It has little to no scent, for those seeking a scentless detergent
cons: The detergent may leach color, especially from dark clothes

customer_reviews.title: I gave this detergent two chances to prove it really ...
customer_reviews.text: I gave this detergent two chances to prove it really worked. Living in a hot, humid environment I work up a sweat when I workout outside so I really wanted a detergent that would get the stink out of my gym clothes. After both soaking/washes my gym clothes had a stinky smell to them. On the 3rd wash I did 1 cup vinegar in a hot wash. Next I did 1/2 a cup of baking soda in a hot wash. Smell was gone!!! My gym clothes had no smell at all in them. Save yourself some money and buy a big box of baking soda and a jug of White Vinegar if you want to clean your gym clothes right.
customer_reviews.author: kpas05

customer_reviews.title: No noticeable difference
customer_reviews.text: I was so bummed about this detergent. I have heard people rave about it for years in the cloth diapering world and finally bought it for my daughter’s gymnastics leotards, which don’t stink yet as she’s too young for body odor. I have washed both her leotards and my bras in this detergent and the bras just don’t get as clean as they do with Forever New delicates wash. And the “dirt” in the pictures the enzymes are supposed to be breaking down out of the fabric? That’s dye. Black “dirt” comes from my bras and red, purple, pink, etc. “dirt” comes from my child’s leotards. Will not re-purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M Chan

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  What's in this stuff??!!!!
customer_reviews.text: What in the world do they put in this stuff?!!! Okay so...I soaked my smelly hot yoga wear and accidentally put a pink undergarment in, as advertised the water turned a nasty mud color. I was like YUCK!!! But...this is were the pink undergarment comes into play...it got stained like turned all sorts of black?? So...my question is, is this really dirt or is it the color of my my yoga wear bleeding? Anyway..the clothes really smelled amazing and it passed the hot yoga test. I have only soaked them once so far and and have washed in my regular detergent around 5 times. So far 5 sweaty classes in and my clothes don't stink during or after yoga. WOW!!!!
customer_reviews.author: FD

customer_reviews.title: I had to soak the items a couple of times ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to soak the items a couple of times before it removed the stink. It does leave behind a weird smell, but it gets covered by using a little fabric softener. I’d take the weird smell over the sweat smell though. Overall, I’m impressed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Was so disappointed with this after reading all the “amazing reviews” online
customer_reviews.text: Was so disappointed with this after reading all the “amazing reviews” online. Doesn’t dissolve all the way, doesn’t make my clothes smell any better, I actually noticed my sweat seemed to linger even after washed. Don’t waste your money, get seventh generations laundry detergent instead!
customer_reviews.author: Alexa Tracy

customer_reviews.title: ZERO change to funky armpit smell
customer_reviews.text: I have tried this detergent as the package has recommended- tried in the washing machine, in the tub as a large batch and pre treating. I have had ZERO results as an improvement in the smell in cotton t shirts. I have had the water in the tub change colors after the soak and a nice scent in the clothing but again- ZERO change in the yucky scent in my lululemon jackets or cotton t shirts. I wish I was still eligible for return because this was a waste of money. Going with The Laundress for another attempt to save my clothes
customer_reviews.author: melanie

customer_reviews.title: DON'T
customer_reviews.text: My teenage son plays football, wrestles and I teach Hot Yoga. Our work out clothes always had a weird smell by the end of the work out. Wash your clothes in this and your whole closet with now have that awful smell. So gross. Soaked the clothes 3x. My clothes went from kinda a bummer at the end of the day to gross stomach turning when you put them on. They are ALL RUINED!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Salas

customer_reviews.title: Might bleach out certain fabrics
customer_reviews.text: I have to be careful what I wash with this stuff. I just threw in a dark load of some workout stuff and some everyday clothes and when they came out of the dryer I noticed some of my shirts had what looked like bleach stains on them. So now I'm afraid to use this because I'm not sure which fabrics it will bleach out and which ones it won't. It's been sitting in my laundry cabinet ever since. Not sure I will ever really use this.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Guminski

customer_reviews.title: Caused rash
customer_reviews.text: I broke out in a bad rash on my legs after wearing a pair of leggings to hot yoga that I soaked and washed with the detergent. I also noticed that the dye from a bright pink bra was bleeding into the water pretty significantly when I was soaking it. This is a bra that has been washed several times already. Also, it seems like the smell of my work out clothes is worse than before. It is not the miracle detergent I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Skeptic here... this is the real deal !!!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, what have I been washing my workout clothes in before this ?!? I saw this advertised on FB of all places and was super skeptical. But, I searched it on amazon and figured I’d give it a try. Backstory, despite washing my workout clothes they always seem to have a strange smell (combo musty and old sweat?). I just tried a soak with CLEAN workout clothes. Literally, I was clearing out my dresser drawers for this experiment and this is what came out of it......
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works but be careful
customer_reviews.text: It works on stains and some smells but it may take a couple tries. What troubled me the most is that it leaches the color out of your clothes. When your water turns brown or gray when you soak your clothes, be wary that some of that "grossness" may actually be some of the color from your clothes being leached out. My sportswear does smell better but it's also a lot more faded.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Hopkins aka DJ chops

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE RASH
customer_reviews.text: Never has any detergent irritated my skin like this product. I followed the instructions for soaking and then washing workout clothes. I was left with a painful rash the next time i wore my workout clothes. I’m not sure how this gets such great reviews? Maybe from paid subscribers? This is why it’s so hard to trust amazon reviews
customer_reviews.author: APC

customer_reviews.title: Makes clothes smell worse
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know what everyone is raving about. This actually makes my clothes smell worse, like mildew/old and rotten clothes. My clothes aren’t usually that dirty to begin with and whenever I wash with this they smell terrible after a few days. I’m very adamant about switching my clothes to the drier immediately after washing them so it’s not that I’m leaving them wet for any period of time. I will not use this product anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: This stuff absolutely ruined some of my clothes. I was extremely hopeful after all the reviews, but it was terrible. Most of the clothes I used this product on came out extremely dingy and smelled worse than before I used it. I wish I hadn't used it because now I'm needing to buy new clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel Soupcoff

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t clean at all!! Everything came out smelling worse then before I put them in. Disappointed. For how expensive this soap is it should do a better job.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I was so hopeful that Rockin' Green would be the answer to my sweaty dreams... I was beyond sad that I didn't get the magical results promised and shown on their FB ads. I guess I could get over the lack of magic if my clothes didn't feel... slippery? I don't really have the word to describe it. Just felt weird. I would ask for a refund but I did use a good deal of it trying to give it the benefit of the doubt. I tried different water temps, different cycles, kept a smell chart... I was so hopeful. Really, really hopeful. Caveat emptor- if it looks to good to be true, it probably is!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine F.

customer_reviews.title: Stains dark cotton clothing!
customer_reviews.text: Any clothing made of the "quick dry" or basketball short material is safe. If, however your clothes are dark and made of 100 percent cotton, you will get light (bleach like) stains on your clothes. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Dan S

customer_reviews.title: Well...
customer_reviews.text: So im sure you have all seen the ad for this where their are clothes in the bathtub and the water is dark from all the dirt and crud it removes.... that's what made me order it! Great advertising, but that's all it was ... advertising! This does not clean my clothes any better than what I was using before. It smells great but the scent is gone by the time you pour it in the washer. My clothes came out of the dryer smelling funky! I washed again and the same thing so I used a different product and they smelled just fine after that. I will not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Celicia

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in this detergent
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this detergent. First I tried soaking in my bathtub, no gross reaction like what others have reported. In fact, the detergent did not mix well and when I drained the tub, I noticed mounds of detergent. This was despite vigorous stirring. Then I moved to using it in the washing machine. I was hoping it would extinguish the stink in my workout clothes, but sadly, it did not. In fact, it left them very stiff and musty smelling. I even tried three washes to try and rinse through the detergent. I ended up washing my clothes in regular detergent and Oxi Clean Odor Eliminator.
customer_reviews.author: AshnOK

customer_reviews.title: Gross smell!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ewe!!! DO NOT BUY THIS!!!! ALL of our clothes smelled rotten after washing with Rockin' Green. I followed the directions as listed and we could not stand the smell!!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: This product is AMAZING. If you have expensive athletic wear that stinks ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is AMAZING. If you have expensive athletic wear that stinks shortly after putting it on clean, you need this product. It works exactly as advertised. I didn't have toss out about 7 t-shirts that I'd washed in different laundry detergents, sanitized, etc. This was my last hope. I tossed these shirts into a Home Depot 5-gallon bucket, 2 scoops of Rockin' Green, and hot water, soaking for a couple hours. I then dumped out the water that was BLACK before washing regularly. The shirts are like new. NO disgusting odor when worn during exercise or outdoors on a hot, humid Florida summer day.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Payne

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed because stuff still smells.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to work, because we have some super stinky workout clothes. After following the directions for our HE washer; allowing it to fill, soaking an hour, then finishing the wash cycle and using an extra rinse. The armpits of several shirts and some sports bras were still stinky when I pulled them out. If it was just one wash and it didn't work, I could understand, but several of the items went through 2 or 3 regular wash cycles with this detergent before I did the soaking method, and it simply hasn't taken care of the smells. :(
customer_reviews.author: Ellen B. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: No Go for me!
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited to get the detergent. I followed the directions. I let them soak longer than suggested. Ran the clothes through the wash cycle with the extra rise. Wore the clothes to work out in today and they I swear they smelt worse. I usually wash with OxiClean. They might smell some at the end of the workout but today I could not wait to change out of them. Waste of my money as far as I am concerned.
customer_reviews.author: sweaty betty

customer_reviews.title: Oh my God
customer_reviews.text: You know that sort of indescribable, often faint, but totally unpleasant smell that accumulates on yoga pants that you catch a whiff of in some public place when you sit down and you go "oh God.. I hope no one else smells that..", and no matter how much you wash them it's still always kinda there? Yeah.. Y'all, this was my CLEAN LAUNDRY! This stuff is insane. And it totally takes the smell out. I'm going to pimp this stuff like there's no tomorrow. When I die, I'm going to put,"use this stuff on your athletic wear" on my headstone.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa

customer_reviews.title: Stuff works as a soak not so much as a detergent
customer_reviews.text: I have used this both ways. As a detergent I didn't like it cause it didn't seem to make a difference. I put my clothes in a tub of hot water with 3-4 scoops and the pic shows what happened after 3 hrs of soaking. We live in hot humid Florida so our clothes get disgusting. This just shows how much our regular detergent wasn't working. I def recommend this product as a soak but not detergent. It works but you've got to have the time to soak your clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Rockin' Green worked on dirty diapers; now on sweaty workout clothes
customer_reviews.text: I first started using Rockin' Green to clean cloth diapers, so it didn't surprise me that they were making active wear detergent. This formula works particularly well for synthetic fabrics used in active wear. My husband is a firefighter who sometimes brings home smoky, stinky clothes that other detergents can't get out; Rockin' Green handles the job. Every few months, I'll do a soak of clean workout cleans just to get extra funk out. We now use it on all of our laundry. I like that it isn't filled with chemicals, fillers and fake scents like other brands. A little goes a long way, so one bag can last months. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mililani Mom

customer_reviews.title: Seems like it worked, but then...
customer_reviews.text: When I first tried out this detergent and soaked by laundry in the tub as instructed (3 scoops, 1 hour), I was amazed at the color the water was left in the tub. Then, after it came out of the drier, it seems to smell neutral (no strong odors, which was great for washing my dog's bed sheets and bed cover). I then went to fold and store the sheets I just washed in the closet. After barely 2 weeks, I went to take out my dog's bed sheet covers to change them, but noticed that there was a terrible funk coming from the previously washed sheets. I will be returning these, and so dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Hilda J.

customer_reviews.title: If you think your clothes are clean, THINK AGAIN!
customer_reviews.text: I found this product through my Instagram newsfeed and I was instantly curious. Already washed gym clothes were put in a solution of this stuff and set to soaking for at least an hour....let me tell you, the results are disgusting! I had no idea that there was still so much grime left in what I thought were clean clothes...my water was brown! Do yourself a favor and buy yourself this!
customer_reviews.author: sharnelle feril

customer_reviews.title: This product actually works
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely skeptical of this product. I felt that maybe the Facebook ad videos were just showing leached dye. But I have a white quilt and shams that never seemed clean even right after laundering so I decided to give this product a try. I added 2 scoops of the powder to my tub with warm water and added the quilt and shams which were literally laundered yesterday. I think the pictures of the tub water speak for themselves. The items are brighter and smell clean. I would absolutely recommend this product. I'm going to try it on my sheets and towels. I'm both slightly disgusted and also amazed.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: I’m a believer.
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty skeptical about this product but my gym friends were raving about it. Decided it was worth a shot. Put my gym clothes in the tub (most were “clean” from the washer, and well... here’s the after 1 hour soak picture. I was thinking the pics I saw before were dye, but I used only my nylon/workout material clothes that I’ve been using for a couple years.. and yeah. That’s not dye. That’s just nastiness. This stuff is legit. Will be buying it continually to prevent any stank I didn’t realize my clothes had!
customer_reviews.author: TH

customer_reviews.title: Tackles sweaty, workout clothes!
customer_reviews.text: After moving in with my boyfriend, I have learned how smelly athletic clothes can really get. He is a pretty heavy sweater, so his workout clothes tend to get soaked..and normal detergent isn't enough to get them smelling completely clean again. This stuff works! I use about two full scoops for his heavily soiled clothes, and it gives them a clean smell rating of about 8/10 (normal detergent would give them 4/10), so it is a huge improvement. It has a pleasant, clean scent! Will repurchase.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley S.

customer_reviews.title: Great results
customer_reviews.text: I soaked my crossfit clothes in the detergent for 30 minutes. This detergent is not scented so I followed up the soak with regular wash cycle and my usual detergent. I was very pleased. Rockin’ Green got the strange funk out of my spandex leggings and workout tops. It did not get the smell out of my shefit flex sports bras (they are more like a neoprene material). Overall I was happy. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JEM

customer_reviews.title: Ehhh Not sure if it actually works
customer_reviews.text: I really really wanted this to work based on the reviews I read. But it just didn't. Maybe my husbands under shirts were just too far gone but even on some of his newer ones it just didn't seem to work. I did the whole soak and then drain and then wash and it just didn't seem to get that stink out :/ I've been adding it to all our loads now to see if it makes a difference on our not so stinky gym and work clothes. I may get another bag to give it another shot but I am disappointed as I was so hopeful it would make his under shirts not smell like a sweay gym bag.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Krueger

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend for workout clothes and leggings!
customer_reviews.text: My husband works out twice a day... so many stinky workout clothes. The sweat was making the other clothes smell weird. I also had an issue with my leggings smelling weird. I’ve been using the detergent for about a month. This detergent has resolved those issues. I recently used it to get out and grease stain from a sweatshirt. It’s been there for probably a year and I was never able to get it out with washing. I put the powder and some water on the stain, scrubbed it in with my finger, soaked it for a few hours and the stain is gone. Amazing!
customer_reviews.author: R & D Porter

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I did the bathtub test with all my exercise clothes. The water was beige not dark grey like in the commercial but that could be props to my washing machine. Anyway, I hate when I'm at the gym, my clothes get a bit sweaty and then I smell...beef stew. Oh my gosh! Its me! Gah! No one wants to smell stew at the gym! I tried everything. Laundry perfumes, sports detergent, Pine cleaner. Nothing worked. Once my freshly laundered exercise clothes became sweaty I could smell the stew. Then I saw a commercial on Facebook for this detergent. I was skeptical but hopeful. Guess what? It worked! After using this detergent I don't smell like beef stew any more.
customer_reviews.author: Cheesemungas

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT REMOVE THE SMELL IN CLOTHES
customer_reviews.text: This product does not work!! I followed the directions very carefully, soaked my stinky workout clothes with three scoops of the detergent for 45 minutes in my laundry ro sink. Then I washed it as directed and even included the extra rinse on my washing machine. My clothes came out smelling the exact same. The laundry room sink was dirty after removing the clothes, but it did absolutely nothing for the smell. My workout clothes still had that stinky mildewy smell after washing and drying them. It’s not worth the $20!
customer_reviews.author: David L

customer_reviews.title: MEH, used this for 1.5 bags and now I'm switching -- Fitness Instructor Review
customer_reviews.text: I used to think this stuff worked great. It seemed like it did. I used it as recommended and with my active gear. I wash and delicate/tumble dry my clothes...the past few months I have noticed when I go to wear my clean clothes they have a weird feeling, they don't smell clean, and for a while I just dealt with it. It felt like there was an excess build up of whatever this stuff leaves behind. Went on vacation and ended up using my mom's detergent which made my clothes feel CLEAN again. This product isn't worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kate W

customer_reviews.title: Makes my athletic clothes smell WORSE than they did before!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I carefully read reviews trying to find the best detergent for my athletic clothes. I am so upset because I have some great athletic clothes (that were not cheap!) that I don't even want to wear because the smell AFTER I washed my clothes carefully following all instructions on this product. Now I am searching for ways to wash this terrible smell out of my clothes!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren A Brothers

customer_reviews.title: I bought this but was skeptical about it. How ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this but was skeptical about it. How could it really work. Well I tried my workout clothes first. I soaked them and it was gross what came out. Then I used it on our white sheets. I threw them in the washer with the active wear. The water was gross as well. I not use it every couple weeks on our sheets and my boys active wear as well as mine. It really does get the smell out.
customer_reviews.author: A. Mohar

customer_reviews.title: Got dogs? GET THIS SOAP!
customer_reviews.text: I thought I'd get the dirtiest item I could think of to try out Rockin' Green Soap: my dog's pillows/bedding. I am shocked at how quickly and effectively it took out the disgusting stains and dirt that was embedded into the fabrics. I can't wait to try it out on my activewear now if it did such a great job with the pup's pillow! I'm SOLD!!
customer_reviews.author: B. Lynn

customer_reviews.title: 100% Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple review to write and digest. I've used Tide for years. I take my workout shorts out of the wash and they smell like death. So I assumed I had to wash them again. Waste of energy, water and time. I did one load of Rockin' Green Soap and they're clean. I repeat. They. Smell. Clean. Blew my mind. No artificial perfume smell, but a light natural cleaning smell. Is this a five star product? Does it actually get your clothes clean? 100% yes. Any negative review must be either shoving too many clothes in their wash packing the washer to the brim or not using a scoop of this detergent. I'll never buy Tide again.
customer_reviews.author: David C

customer_reviews.title: It works OK not a cure all. Vinegar soak is better.
customer_reviews.text: We use this on our martial arts stuff. Gis, compression gear etc. This works ok for maintenance, but sometimes nothing will get the sour out of workout gear but a good 24 hour white vinegar soak. Use a bucket or cooler and add about 3 gal water and 1 gal white vinegar. Soak your gear for 24 HOURS then wash twice in the washing machine with detergent to get the vinegar out. Rockin Green is a good maintenance wash, but it won’t knock out the really harsh stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Charles T.

customer_reviews.title: too expensive
customer_reviews.text: it works good to get the smell out of clothes. but its too expensive. I don't know how they can get 90 loads per package, I only get about 25-30 loads out of a bag and I use as little as possible. the other thing I really dislike is that when I receive the bag, it always has some residue on it and it gets all over my hands. I have to clean the bag before I can even use it. I really think they should lower the price. its a tiny bag as well.
customer_reviews.author: esprit

customer_reviews.title: It actually works...
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical and my six-year-old, tropical-climate, "I-only-wash-with-eco-safe-detergent" spandex was horrendously stinky. After the first soak and wash, I went to the gym and there was no horrible smell wafting about. There was still a slight smell after my workout, but it seems to be fading with each soak/wash cycle (used it 3 times now). I also work as a massage therapist and struggle to get lotion/oil residues out of the sheets, but this stuff is really helping!
customer_reviews.author: Lily Koi

customer_reviews.title: Amazing stuff!! If you think your stuff is clean- it’s not until you use this!
customer_reviews.text: I have used rocking green for my youngest child’s cloth diapers years ago. Bought this because you can soak and “strip” your activewear and it removes all the “funk” that accumulates in activewear clothing. It really did work and now they are fresh and clean and the water after the soak was disgusting- after being washed regularly! We also use this during the week now and sprinkle a little bit in a bowl and soak our masks - it has tea tree oil in it and works beautifully !
customer_reviews.author: Frank Love

customer_reviews.title: This product did not work for me. I sweat ...
customer_reviews.text: This product did not work for me. I sweat A LOT and my gym clothes take a beating. I used this detergent and it didn't make a difference in the smell, 10 minutes into a workout and the funky clothing smell was back. I also tried it as a soak and it didn't seem to make a difference. It showed that there was dirt in the clothes but it did not take the smell away. This was a miss for me.
customer_reviews.author: Saraht

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: This did not get my laundry smelling clean. I can't attest to stain power as I didn't use on stains. I used as directed: 2 scoops for gym clothes (extra scoop!) I let it soak for an hour and then washed with an extra rinse. Once dry, everything smelled sour and I had to rewash with Charlie's soap which did the trick. Then, I tried it again on a blanket my child's diaper soaked through. After pulling it from the dryer, it still smelled like pee. That's a no from me. I have no desire to rewash any more loads of laundry, so will not use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Smith

customer_reviews.title: Be careful with color fade !!!
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited about this product. I used it on my boyfriend’s law enforcement uniform shirts, which is a black tactical polo with gold embroidered badge and his name. Just a warning, after I soaked them in the tub and then completed in washer, the stitching of his name and badge went from gold to very very pale yellow. Probably should have done a test shirt instead of all his shirts at once. At $60 a piece, I’m hoping his sergeant doesn’t notice.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!!
customer_reviews.text: i was skeptical about buying this after reading reviews and watching videos. i went ahead and soaked a few of my clean workout clothes for a test. after an hour, i could not believe how brownish the water. all along i thought i was wearing clean clothes! after i washed them in the machine and dried them, there’s a noticeable difference in the odor and feel. it was like brand new! i then washed ALL my workout clothes because who doesn’t want to clean stuff? i’ve then since used on all my subsequent washes. very impressed with this product, and will definitely purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: americanthighs

customer_reviews.title: Saved my towels from the trash bin
customer_reviews.text: I have been struggling with bath towels seeming to be fresh right out of the dryer. Then BAM! One post shower dry off and the towels smell like they have been sitting damp for days, festering with god knows what. It was the most disgusting thing. I was going to throw my towels away and buy new ones. Then my sister suggested I try this detergent. She had the same issues I was having. One wash and almost all of them are 100% better. I think some need a second wash because they were worse than others. This saved me from buying all new towels. Well worth the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Grey A.A.

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: I DO think it helped my gym clothes smell less funky than detergent alone, but not 100% clean/normal. I got a different product since using this that educated me NOT to use fabric softeners as they will trap the bad B.O. smells in.......so I think that may be why this product didn't work as well for me because I was still using fabric softeners with it when I tried it. SO if you buy/use this product be sure NOT to use fabric softeners when using it before you give up on its effectiveness!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for residual smell! Even works in front loader
customer_reviews.text: This works amazingly well on urine bedding from our bedwetter. Previously I had a hard time getting the residual smell out of blankets or sheet protectors. Two scoops of this, a little fabric softener and they are super fresh smelling! I have a friend loader, so I put one scoop inside the washer and one scoop in the detergent tray (without the liquid detergent holder). Also soaked dirty tennis shoes in this then washed in the washer and they came out sparkling clean!
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: Magic...gets stuff truly clean!
customer_reviews.text: Magic for stink, I tell you!! I keep a bag of this on hand for anything that starts to smell sour and run it through after a soak. It is the ONLY thing I have found to clean gross kitchen cloths and my son’s icky, smelly hockey gear. Watching the brown get sucked out of the cloth is both disgusting and amazing at the same time. So glad one of the other hockey moms turned me onto this stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work.
customer_reviews.text: Soaked my cycling clothes in our tub for an hour with this and then washed them in the machine with even more. I ran an extra rinse cycle and then a regular wash with our detergent and another extra rinse cycle. I am impressed, 90% or more of the funk is gone. I hardly noticed that funky smell on my next ride. I’m only giving 4 out of 5 star because of the odd scent that it has. I’d give it 4.5 but I can’t.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Makes clothes stink!
customer_reviews.text: Everything washed in this stuff stinks! After several tries, i’m throwing this expensive stuff out. It’s just not worth it! I have to rewash everything. Sport Suds works great! Going back to that.
customer_reviews.author: Kite Mom

customer_reviews.title: Rash/Hives
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to try this concentrated powder and get away from the big names in the laundry detergent world. However, this stuff makes me itch like crazy — I’ve broken out in little bumps everywhere and I don’t even have sensitive skin! After reading tons of reviews, it looks like the majority hasn’t dealt with this issue, but I am one of the lucky few that have. Guess I’ll go back to one of the big names until I find something else worth a try.
customer_reviews.author: SRinSD

customer_reviews.title: but the grey color of the old armpit stains and smell of layers of deodorant mixed with sweat were pretty much gone
customer_reviews.text: My husband wears white undershirts to work and they are the victims of grey deodorant and sweat stains. I thought I would give Active Wear a try to see if it could possibly get his shirts somewhat clean. I soaked one shirt overnight and threw it in the wash using Active Wear. The shirt came out clean! There was still a yellowish armpit stain, but the grey color of the old armpit stains and smell of layers of deodorant mixed with sweat were pretty much gone! Will use this from now on to wash our clothes.
customer_reviews.author: CRISTINA BRANSFORD

customer_reviews.title: Cleans well and smells great!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using Charlie’s soap for my diapers and actually all of my laundry because my family has sensitive skin, but I decided to try the rockin’ green platinum series after seeing an Instagram of clean clothes soaked in the tub and the residue that was left behind. I have not done the tub soak challenge, but I can attest that my laundry smells fresher than it did with using Charlie’s soap in conjunction with Method fabric softener. *I still love and will continue to use Charlie’s soap, though
customer_reviews.author: 11toyour7

customer_reviews.title: The stink is GONE!!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my...found this stuff by accident. At the moment, I can't say enough about it. Hubby can now go to the gym without smelling as if he's been wearing his clothes for a week before they've been washed. This stuff really does work. I can't say if it works in the bathtub, but I can say it works in a front loader washing machine! One scoop of this stuff, with one pod and voila...the smell is gone! I've been using it on our towels, which we all know get to smell so musty after a while, and they come out smelling 'fresh as a daisy!' Yep, this stuff really works, and is so worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Eleanor Rose Godfrey

customer_reviews.title: Works for Workout Gear
customer_reviews.text: It works for my workout gear, when other things like OxiClean haven’t. I’m not crazy about the tea tree oil scent, but I only seem to notice it when I’m scooping it out. It doesn’t seem to leave a lasting tea tree oil scent in the clothes. Honestly, you’ll probably need to follow the “intense build up” instructions where you soak the clothes for 30-60 minutes and then run them through the rinse cycle. I found that when I just used it as detergent in the regular wash cycle, there was still some essence of crotch odor. Anyway, I’ll keep using this until I can find something that may work even better and smells better.
customer_reviews.author: DTodd

customer_reviews.title: Warehouse worker don’t stink like one any more!
customer_reviews.text: I was entirely skeptical but after trying their sample packs with shirts already washed and hanging in the closet, the water was grey. After washing with this, work shirts no longer had a funk to them after wearing them a little while. Funky bath towels no longer stink after first use after a washing. This stuff really works. I bought a bag and use it once a month for work clothes and towels.
customer_reviews.author: AnnieM

customer_reviews.title: Removes sweaty stink when nothing else can
customer_reviews.text: This is the only detergent that actually gets the smell out of my running clothes. There’s something about all the fancy synthetic wicking fabrics they use for running clothes where it just soaks up all the stinky sweat smell and regular laundry detergents do nothing to get rid of the smell (even with soaking and multiple washes). A good soak and wash with Rockin’ Green and the smell is gone. I train for full marathons once or twice a year, so I log a lot of sweaty miles in my running clothes. Rockin’ Green is the only detergent I use for all of my running gear.
customer_reviews.author: Olwe Fefalas

customer_reviews.title: AMAZED- no idea how this hasn't worked for some reviewers
customer_reviews.text: I usually use white vinegar to pre-soak our clothes + seventh generation as a safer/more natural option for my husband and I. However, we are extremely active/addicted to the sauna so our clothes need more than what other natural alternatives offer to get the sweat/smell out. I didn't even have to soak any of our clothes in the tub like some of the pictures. I just used 2 scoops in my HE front loader + more than normal rinse cycles and our clothes smell amazing!!! I ran out of ActiveWear detergent and thought I would give my old stuff a try----horrible smelling clothes again. HIGHLY recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Cate

customer_reviews.title: This works!
customer_reviews.text: Plain and simple-after using for six months, this stuff works. After doing two initial long soaks, I make sure to separate all the workout clothes now, using the 'pre-soak' cycle in the wash. There's zero remnant of funk. I sweat more than the average guy and I'm exercising 4+ times a week, if it didn't work I would know. I highly recommend if you have some items that you think need thrown away but would be just fine with a 'refreshing'-this will do it.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Solves stinky Army uniforms!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to get rid of the chronic gym smell (even when just washed!) in my husband’s Army physical training uniform. This has saved us at least $75 from having to replace all of his uniforms every few months because they get so stinky. I even used it on some old towels that tended to retain the mildewy smell even after freshly washed or after the first one or two uses. I’m shocked at how little product is required; That bag will definitely last us!!
customer_reviews.author: Mother Kate

customer_reviews.title: This is a true game changer....
customer_reviews.text: I was a diehard gain fan. I started noticing our clothes were having a smell, especially if they got wet due to rain or sweat. So I saw a Facebook ad on this, and made the purchase only to due the initial soak to remove the odors and go back to gain for regular washing. Soon I began noticing that smell again. I started using this as our regular detergent with gain softener for the scent I love so much, and haven’t noticed the smell again. I never thought I would change laundry detergents, but now I will never go back.
customer_reviews.author: CW2010

customer_reviews.title: Works well on workout (and regular) clothes
customer_reviews.text: Works well on both workout and regular clothes -- really gets the funk out from my running / cycling gear and I only use the recommended two tablespoons per one HE load. There is a (very) mild scent from the tea tree oil, but it is not overpowering and more importantly for me, the fragrance does not aggravate my sensitive skin. My one (small) quibble is that the seal on the top of the bag inevitably falls apart on me after a few weeks. (This has happened to me more than once.) Obviously, it's not much of a deterrent, though, since I have bought this product multiple times and will continue to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Yodi-wan

customer_reviews.title: Removed impossible stain; doesn’t fade clothes
customer_reviews.text: Some topical medicine from the dermatologist stained a favorite running shirt. After a failed attempt to remove with Persil, I thought for sure it was a goner. This detergent got it out with no problem! After using this for more than a year, I can safely say that it hasn’t faded or shrunk any of my Lululemon, Adidas, Arcteryx, Salomon, North Face or other brands of dry fit clothing and gear. Thoroughly impressed!
customer_reviews.author: MBennett

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!!! No more funky smells!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pack of rockin green I have purchased and it seriously removes all those funky odors from workout clothes and my kids sports clothes. My workout clothes used to have that weird odor after 10 minutes of exercising and now they stay fresh. I would recommend soaking all your exercise clothes in the sink for an hour and then put them in the washing machine, when you first order this product and you will immediately notice a difference. Now I add a scoop to every wash. I also wash all my workout clothes and sports bras separately to other clothes and air dry them all as i think the dryer can affect the smell!
customer_reviews.author: Mazzy218

customer_reviews.title: Skeptic
customer_reviews.text: Being a skeptic about this product I had to just try it.... I washed my CLEAN clothes in the sink, saw the dirt and grim that came out of them (just like the pictures and videos). Gross.... I drained the sink and just to see... did it again. To my surprise, the dirt and grim that showed up diminished quite a bit! I did it a third time and at this time I was certain that my clothes were clean as the water stayed clean. I thought it may had been a trick that the detergent changes the color of the water, but that is not the case! I will be purchasing again thats for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Christina DeLakis

customer_reviews.title: Takes the stink out
customer_reviews.text: I. Love. This. Soap. I workout daily and my clothes used to stink. My friend told me about this and I gave it a shot...what did I have to lose? I have been using it since August 2019 and it is legit. My clothes no longer smell. I use it once a week (give or take) and still have so much left. A little does go a long way. I was apprehensive to buy it at first, because of the price, but it is now the only thing I will wash my gym clothes in. I am also going to try it on a pair of stinky 12 year old boy tennis shoes. I'll report back my findings!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Furrenes

customer_reviews.title: This product causes a serious rash
customer_reviews.text: This will cause a serious rash that no lotion or medicine will fix. If you have it stop using it, if you are thinking of buying it DONT! Please dont use it for diapers it will make your child and your life miserable!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Soaked my husband's phone armband that smelled like a locker room
customer_reviews.text: Soaked my husband's phone armband that smelled like a locker room. While the armband came out of the soaking/wash clean and smelling better, after one use it was back to it's original stench. On a positive note, the stench of the gym bag smell reminded me of growing up with athletic brothers and offered a brief moment of nostalgia...and then I remembered growing up with brothers and the moment was lost.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: I thought my clothes were clean....
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting to try this stuff but kept putting it off because I’m cheap! With the warmer weather and my workout clothes actually being used for working out... it was time to try it out. I did a hot water soak and let me tell you what- I feel so filthy! It looked like a mud bath! If you need to get some nasty out of your clothes you should definitely try it out!
customer_reviews.author: straightlace22

customer_reviews.title: Finally something that works!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is the only thing that I have found that removes soiled smells from my workout clothes. That said, I find it most effective when I soak the clothes for a few hours prior to washing them. I was about to pitch out my workout gear until this was recommended to me be a hockey dad and thank god he did! That mildew smell that would present itself about 15 minutes into my workout has been totally eradicated. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Charles L. Rapier

customer_reviews.title: Just pulls color out of your clothes— it’s not grime.
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to try this after all the Facebook ads on my gym clothes that had an odor post wash on them. All this did was pull out and strip the dye from my clothing. It even had the purple tint that is indicative of clothing dye. Overall, I paid to ruin my guys clothes. Next time, use a little blue dawn and some white vinegar diluted.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee

customer_reviews.title: The best.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this stuff. I live in an apartment with shared laundry facilities so I can't control what other folks use as detergent before me, but this stuff gets my clothes CLEAN. Like, they don't have any lingering smells like they did before when I used regular detergent. And I love that it's green and environmentally friendly. I probably get some gross chemical residues from using shared washers & dryers, but at least I know MY load is as healthy as possible. I wash everything I own with it—it's my everyday detergent. I'd give it 6 stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: jamestown

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well, better with new garments
customer_reviews.text: I use this product for active wear and bras. Started off with soaking (clean) older bras and sports bras to get the build-up of old sweat out. Then washed in the machine with this product. Okay result when clean and dry, smells nice and fresh, but once wearing the garments and sweating, the smell comes back, even with re-soaking every now and then. Works better for new garments that have always been washed with this product, they stay fresh even during workouts/sweating. Will continue using product as it’s not as bad as regular detergent and I want to keep my new clothes fresh for longer.
customer_reviews.author: YP

customer_reviews.title: Gets the yuck smell out of all my workout stuff!
customer_reviews.text: This is the third time I've ordered the Rockin Green Active Wear detergent. It makes such a HUGE difference in my work out clothing. I do hot yoga and my boyfriend does jujitsu, so there is a lot of sweat going on in our household. A good soak has cleaned even the smelliest of clothing (that was previously being washed with regular detergent) and I'll never wash my active wear in anything again. I used Rockin Green products when I cloth diapered my son and I can say that they make a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Irishmegand

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff!
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff. My husband is a coach and this is how we get stinky sweat and body odor out of practice gear. I use nothing else. It beats vinegar and baking soda hands down! The water is so dirty and nasty when you soak sports wear in it you’ll wonder why you didn’t start using it sooner to get all of that sweat out of the fabric. It doesn’t ruin fabrics either. You might think it would be harsh on them, it’s not. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wise

customer_reviews.title: Left a musty smell
customer_reviews.text: Soaked clothes in the tub with this as per directions and the water did turn yucky brown. However, after washing a few regular loads of laundry I noticed I was always smelling a musty smell. The smell was so bad I was constantly sneezing. After further inspection, I noticed the smell was coming from my clothes. I tried washing the drum of my washer and my shirts still smelled musty. The only thing I've been doing differently with my laundry is using this detergent, so it must be the culprit. Won't use again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked really great!
customer_reviews.text: I had heard about Rockin’ Green from some friends that used it during their time cloth diapering and they were really pleased with its ability to clean and remove odors. I purchased the active wear formula for some gym clothes that had a lingering smell despite soaking other ways. I followed the soak directions and all of my active wear no longer has the smell. I soaked a batch of towels that had also picked up a funk and those are not only brighter, but have no more stink! Definitely a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: MSR84

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!!
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered this product many times, and it never ceases to amaze me! I am a long distance runner that loves to run in the heat. I like to soak my running clothes in a bin with hot water and a few scoops of Rockin' Green. It has prolonged the life of my clothes but helping pull the accumulated sweat and general nastiness out before washing. I will continue to order this product as long as it's available!
customer_reviews.author: NQ

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!! Saves you money!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I own a Gym, and love our workout apparel. A lot of these clothing materials keep the sweat and product one might be using on their body ( sweet sweat) in the fibers. I can’t tell you how many times I’ve thrown amazing shirts away because they just stink no matter how many times I’ve washed them. This product is amazing!! I recommend soaking clothing in a tub first or if your washer has the pre-soak setting use that. A little goes a long way too! The scoop is small. Tom of product in these bags.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Leaves clothes smelling SOUR!
customer_reviews.text: I used this product multiple times to help get the “stink” out of our clothes from working out. Turns out this product only made it WORSE!!!! I ended up throwing the rest away weeks ago and we’re still finding clothes in our drawers that we’re having to throw straight into to laundry before wearing again because they smell THAT bad. Tide detergent mixed with Downy freshener has helped them return back to normal. What a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Sheek

customer_reviews.title: Great for bike clothes
customer_reviews.text: We use this every week on my husband bike clothes. (He rides to work every day about an hour) Bike clothes can get pretty smelly in the summer months and I’ve found this gets them clean and fresh. The first time we pre-soaked in the bathtub the water was so gross, proving this is a necessary step.
customer_reviews.author: SNT

customer_reviews.title: Must Buy!!
customer_reviews.text: i bought this to try and strip my clothes!! but so far i’ve only used a scoop per laundry load and i have noticed a difference in all around cleanliness! i live in an apartment complex and i never feel like my clothes get 100% clean since i’m sharing the space with others.... but rockin green kicks my worries away!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea B

customer_reviews.title: ... soak my work out clothes and even whites with super hot water
customer_reviews.text: I tried on several occasions to soak my work out clothes and even whites with super hot water. Soaked for about an hour (in bathtub) and washed in washing machine on hot. Some clothes still came out with that funky smell... its nice that the ingredients are safe but will have to find some other detergent with more cleaning power (for extra dirty clothes)
customer_reviews.author: fox.seachel

customer_reviews.title: Works to Remove Old Funky Smells
customer_reviews.text: There was an old smell in my Krav Maga (martial arts) training shirts that I couldn't get out. They would smell clean out of the wash but within the first 5 minutes of sweating the odor appears. I soaked the shirts in the tub with this product (I added extra scoops) for an hour. Visually I could see a tremendous amount of dirty water. Then I washed and hung dry. I trained last night with zero smell. Excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Cassone

customer_reviews.title: Smelly gym clothes smell clean again
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased several detergents for my husband's gym clothes and some didn't work and others worked ok. There was still a little smell afterwards, but not with this product. I saw an ad on Instagram, ordered from Amazon and gave it a try. Wish I found this product sooner. I only use 1 scoop for each load and they come out smelling clean and fresh. I'm going to add this to my subscribe & save shipments that's how much I'm loving this product.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Clumps. Rock hard clumps.
customer_reviews.text: The 2 stars is not for lack of cleaning ability. It is simply due to the large, rock hard clumps that I was shipped. Thinking that they would dissolve in the wash cycle, I added one to a load only to find it creating a racket in the dryer. I put that "rock" in a jar of water and let it sit overnight--and only then did it dissolve.
customer_reviews.author: TheBABrad

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Being a very clean person I was dumb-struck with this weird smell after working and sweating outside for a short period. I always put on clean clothes. The smell wasn't me but rather my clothes! I noticed an ad and felt that it completely addressed my needs. I thought I would try the product. I soaked my clothes in this product before washing and the picture shows what the water looked like after soaking. Thankfully, I didn't have to replace my clothes. Yes, the product is expensive but I don't know of a better way to clean them completely!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solution to your smelly gym clothes
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this stuff. I have tried MANY different soaps and soaks for my smelly gym clothes. You know the funky smell the emanates from your gym clothes after you've warmed up even when they're clean? The ones that smell clean coming out of the washer or dryer but still manage to get super smelly super fast? Well, this is the solution! I soak all of my workout clothes every other week and they no longer get that funky smell. Nothing else has worked like rockin' green. I didn't believe it would work until I tried and I'm so thankful I did. Nice job Rockin' Green!!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: This WORKS! No more stinky towels and exercise clothes
customer_reviews.text: I was intrigued by the reviews and ordered right away -- I LOVE this stuff. My exercise clothes were not smelling fresh after washing. And our bathroom towels smelled funny after one or two uses after being washed. Just one tablespoon of this stuff in a full load of clothes does the trick! (I add a little of my Arm and Hammer detergent, just because.) Amazing! I also bought the lavender mint detergent for all my other regular laundry. I'm promoting this on my Zumba facebook page as well.
customer_reviews.author: HILDI P.

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t remove odors as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t remove any odors from athletic wear. I even soaked the items for an hour in the detergent before washing. Tea tree has antimicrobial and antifungal properties so in essence it should work. However it did not. Perhaps the ratio of the oil in the detergent needs to be higher in content or a better grade of oil should be used.
customer_reviews.author: battina collard

customer_reviews.title: Really works
customer_reviews.text: So I got my stuff today and I am impressed! My husband Runs heavy equipment and stays out in the heat all day. He always complained about how they always smelled no matter what we tried . So when I saw this product I said what the heck!! I ordered and tried it today I did a 60 min soak on his uniforms . And WOW!! The water was super gross!!! And after washing them taking them out of the washing machine the smell gone they smelt amazing ! Dryer they spelled like new clothes!! I highly recommend!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Jean Holloman Barnes

customer_reviews.title: less expensive than replacing workout clothes
customer_reviews.text: Great! It must dissolve well because I do not find residue in the folds of the clothes. Smells more like tea tree than other brands I have used. works well for the month I’ve had i by killing some nasty funky odors. Pricey for a detergent but less expensive than replacing my workout clothes
customer_reviews.author: No Sked

customer_reviews.title: Best Investment Ever!!
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best investment ever. That’s right it’s an investment. I love my gym clothes and hate the smell that arose from my shirts every time I washed and wore them. This detergent has saved me money and has allowed me to feel fresh and clean during my workouts. I tested it this product by washing the blankets my dogs sleep on. 3 dogs, a few blankets and bam they don’t have any odors on them. My mind was blown. I will have this shipped monthly. Thanks for the great product.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan marshall

customer_reviews.title: Great cleaning product
customer_reviews.text: I have several sports bras that have retained a funky smell after washing. I tried everything to eliminate the musty odor from the bras, but nothing worked. My friend recommended this product to me. I bought it and tried immediately. It is an amazing product and one I would highly recommend to eliminate any musty odor from your active wear. My bras actually smell pleasant again.
customer_reviews.author: Scrapbook Mom

customer_reviews.title: You may hate the way this makes your clothes smell!
customer_reviews.text: This product made my load of laundry smell like vomit. The company tried to tell me my clothes must be so dirty that it's taking out the grime, but I had to rewash those clothes numerous times and they still stink. I returned it for sure and bought a different athletic detergent that is supposed to be scent free.
customer_reviews.author: KHosley

product_meta.title: Rockin' Green Platinum Series Active Wear Laundry Detergent Powder, 45 oz. - All Natural, Biodegradable, and Eco-Friendly
feature_bullets: ⭐ THE ORIGINAL LAUNDRY SOAP FOR SPORTSTERS - Don't be the one who washes their athletic gear and thinks it's clean, but starts to stink before the workout even begins. Rockin' Green Active Wear Detergent is the ORIGINAL funk-fighting detergent for your activewear. Specially designed by athletes to fight odors in high-tech fabrics of brands such as Adidas, Alo Yoga, Fabletics, Gymshark, Lululemon, Mika, Nike, Prana, Zella, etc.

🏃 A POWDER DETERGENT FOR ALL - For sportswear, uniforms, athletic gear, and high tech fabrics, or even all-purpose natural laundry detergent - we’ve got your back! With plant-derived enzymes and clean rinsing surfactants, our activewear detergent is no match for the funks lingering in your favorite workout shorts, sports bra, or tank top.

🌿 ALL NATURAL DETERGENT - We use all natural ingredients with the extra cleaning punch of tea tree oil. Rockin' Green Active Wear sports detergent is proudly made in the USA while also free from phosphates, bleach, optical brighteners, parabens, and SLS / SLES, and is never tested on animals.

🚫 SAFELY STOP THE STINK - Stops the stink and sweat stains in your gear and saves the planet too. No dyes, gluten-free, vegan, excellent in hard water and totally biodegradable, this natural laundry soap is safe for septic and grey-water systems.

♻️ JOIN THE ROCKIN' FAMILY - We pride ourselves in bringing you eco-friendly, all-natural powdered laundry detergents. Whether you need a funk-fighting sweat smell remover or an ammonia bouncer pre-treatment for cloth diapers - we’ve got you covered.
